tool.name: Paffy dechunk
tool.description: manipulates coordinates to allow aggregation of PAFs computed over subsequences
tool.command: #if $input_paf.ext.endswith('.gz') gunzip -c '$input_paf' | #end if paffy dechunk --logLevel 'INFO' --outputFile '$out_file' #if not $input_paf.ext.endswith('.gz') --inputFile '$input_paf' #end if
tool.help: Paffy dechunk adjusts PAF alignment coordinates that were produced by ´faffy chunk´. It removes the chunk-specific encoding and converts all alignments back to the original, global coordinate system. For this, the query and target names in each alignment must contain their chunk-specific encoding (delimited by ``|``, e.g.: ``Name|Length|Start``). As output, a new PAF file is generated with updated coordinates.
